Sentencas: A novel integrated system consisting of an external heat source, a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell (DC-SOFC), a vacuum thermionic generator (VTIG) and a regenerator is proposed to handle the heat management of the DC-SOFC.
Titulo: A feasible way to handle the heat management of direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical/chemical reactions, ionic/electronic charge transport, mass/momentum transport and heat transfer are fully considered in the 2D tubular DC-SOFC model, which shows that the overall heat released in the cell is always different from the heat required by the internal Boudouard reaction.
Titulo: A feasible way to handle the heat management of direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Three different operation strategies of the proposed system are presented, and accordingly, analytical expressions for the overall power output and efficiency for the proposed system are specified.
Titulo: A feasible way to handle the heat management of direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results show that the VTIG could effectively recover the waste heat for additional power production at a large operating current density, and the maximum power density and efficiency of the proposed system could reach more than 8100 W m(-2) and 60% at 30,000 A m(-2) and 1173 K, respectively.
Titulo: A feasible way to handle the heat management of direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effects of the operating current density, the operating temperature and the distance between the carbon layer and anode of the DC-SOFC, and the size, anode temperature and work function of the VTIG on the performance of the proposed system are discussed through comprehensive parametric studies.
Titulo: A feasible way to handle the heat management of direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells
